publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2083 Tommy Sheridan: BNP in Scotland—That the Parliament deplores the presence of the fascist and racist BNP in Scotland and in particular their visits to areas of Glasgow such as Sighthill and Pollokshields; believes that their only purpose is to stir up racial hatred between asylum seekers, members of ethnic minorities and local communities, when members of all these communities have been striving to build bridges, and calls upon the media not to provide a platform for the racist and fascist views of organisations like the BNP which are designed to spread hatred, division and fear, particularly among ethnic communities.
S1M-2083 BNP in Scotland (lodged on 19 July 2001) Robin Harper*, Michael Matheson*
S1M-2083 BNP in Scotland (lodged on 19 July 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Shona Robison*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2083 BNP in Scotland (lodged on 19 July 2001) Colin Campbell*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-2083 Tommy Sheridan: BNP in Scotland—That the Parliament deplores the presence of the fascist and racist BNP in Scotland and in particular their visits to areas of Glasgow such as Sighthill and Pollokshields; believes that their only purpose is to stir up racial hatred between asylum seekers, members of ethnic minorities and local communities, when members of all these communities have been striving to build bridges, and calls upon the media not to provide a platform for the racist and fascist views of organisations like the BNP which are designed to spread hatred, division and fear, particularly among ethnic communities. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Shona Robison, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Brian Adam, Michael Russell
S1M-2083 BNP in Scotland (lodged on 19 July 2001) Irene McGugan*

S1M-2083 Tommy Sheridan: BNP in Scotland-That the Parliament deplores the presence of the fascist and racist BNP in Scotland and in particular their visits to areas of Glasgow such as Sighthill and Pollokshields; believes that their only purpose is to stir up racial hatred between asylum seekers, members of ethnic minorities and local communities, when members of all these communities have been striving to build bridges, and calls upon the media not to provide a platform for the racist and fascist views of organisations like the BNP which are designed to spread hatred, division and fear, particularly among ethnic communities. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Shona Robison, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Brian Adam, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan
S1M-2083 BNP in Scotland (lodged on 19 July 2001) Andrew Wilson*

S1M-2083 Tommy Sheridan: BNP in Scotland—That the Parliament deplores the presence of the fascist and racist BNP in Scotland and in particular their visits to areas of Glasgow such as Sighthill and Pollokshields; believes that their only purpose is to stir up racial hatred between asylum seekers, members of ethnic minorities and local communities, when members of all these communities have been striving to build bridges, and calls upon the media not to provide a platform for the racist and fascist views of organisations like the BNP which are designed to spread hatred, division and fear, particularly among ethnic communities. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Shona Robison, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Brian Adam, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Andrew Wilson

S1M-2083 Tommy Sheridan: BNP in Scotland-That the Parliament deplores the presence of the fascist and racist BNP in Scotland and in particular their visits to areas of Glasgow such as Sighthill and Pollokshields; believes that their only purpose is to stir up racial hatred between asylum seekers, members of ethnic minorities and local communities, when members of all these communities have been striving to build bridges, and calls upon the media not to provide a platform for the racist and fascist views of organisations like the BNP which are designed to spread hatred, division and fear, particularly among ethnic communities.
